thread.title: Super Spieth signs up for Singapore Open in January
thread.title_full: Super Spieth signs up for Singapore Open in January

title: Super Spieth signs up for Singapore Open in January
text:
Super Spieth signs up for Singapore Open in January Tuesday October 20, 2015 Print Article 
Jordan Spieth ‘can’t wait to visit Singapore for the first time’. — John David Mercer-USA TODAY Sports/ Reuters file pic SINGAPORE, Oct 20 — Player of the Year Jordan Spieth will skip the Farmers Insurance Open on the PGA Tour to instead play in the revived Singapore Open in January, organisers announced today. 
The 22-year-old world number two enjoyed a breakout 2015, winning the Masters, US Open and the PGA Tour Championship among his five victories as he went on to claim the lucrative FedEx Cup. 
“Playing in the SMBC Singapore Open is something I’m really looking forward to,” Spieth said in a statement. 
“I’m very fortunate to play golf around the world and can’t wait to visit Singapore for the first time.” 
The 50th Singapore Open, featuring prize money of at least US$1 million (RM4.2 million), will be played on the Sentosa Golf Club’s demanding Serapong Course from January 28-31 on the Asian and Japan Golf Tours after a three-year absence. 
Spieth missed the cut at the US$6.5 million Farmers Insurance Open in January at the famed Torrey Pines course in San Diego, where current world number one Jason Day of Australia triumphed after a four-man playoff. — Reuters
